response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "medium", "Being a young adult (22 years old) contributes moderately to risk since younger individuals statistically have a higher likelihood of recidivism."],
    ["Race", "low", "Identification as White is not strongly associated with increased criminal recidivism risk relative to other demographic factors."],
    ["Arrest History", "medium", "One arrest, even without conviction, indicates some interaction with the criminal justice system, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Conviction History", "low", "No convictions suggest lower formal criminal involvement, moderating overall risk."],
    ["Physical Profile (Height/Weight)", "low", "Average physical characteristics (5'9\" and 155 lbs) do not contribute significantly to recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status", "medium", "Never married and living alone imply reduced social support, which can moderately affect recidivism risk."],
    ["Educational Attainment", "medium", "Having a high school diploma without higher education can contribute to moderate risk due to lower socioeconomic protections."],
    ["College Enrollment", "low", "Not being enrolled in college is common in this profile and only slightly affects risk."],
    ["Employment History", "medium", "Holding 2 jobs during the year indicates employment instability, which moderately increases risk."],
    ["Drug Use (Marijuana)", "medium", "Recent drug use contributes a moderate risk factor, as substance use is associated with recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (Depressive Episodes)", "medium", "Recent episodes of feeling down can affect decision-making and contribute moderately to risk."],
    ["Family Background", "low", "Living with both biological parents in youth suggests a stable early family environment, which is a protective factor."],
    ["Household Size in Youth", "low", "Growing up in a household of three is neutral to slightly protective in terms of risk."],
    ["Geographic Upbringing (Urban Area)", "medium", "Urban upbringing can expose one to environments with higher crime rates, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Religiosity", "low", "Believing that God has a role in personal outcomes can provide some psychosocial support, reducing risk moderately."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: Being a young adult (22 years old) contributes moderately to risk since younger individuals statistically have a higher likelihood of recidivism.
Identification as White is not strongly associated with increased criminal recidivism risk relative to other demographic factors.
One arrest, even without conviction, indicates some interaction with the criminal justice system, contributing moderately to risk.
No convictions suggest lower formal criminal involvement, moderating overall risk.
Average physical characteristics (5'9" and 155 lbs) do not contribute significantly to recidivism risk.
Never married and living alone imply reduced social support, which can moderately affect recidivism risk.
Having a high school diploma without higher education can contribute to moderate risk due to lower socioeconomic protections.
Not being enrolled in college is common in this profile and only slightly affects risk.
Holding 2 jobs during the year indicates employment instability, which moderately increases risk.
Recent drug use contributes a moderate risk factor, as substance use is associated with recidivism.
Recent episodes of feeling down can affect decision-making and contribute moderately to risk.
Living with both biological parents in youth suggests a stable early family environment, which is a protective factor.
Growing up in a household of three is neutral to slightly protective in terms of risk.
Urban upbringing can expose one to environments with higher crime rates, contributing moderately to risk.
Believing that God has a role in personal outcomes can provide some psychosocial support, reducing risk moderately.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
